title: Council Regulation (EEC) No 1800/86 of 9 June 1986 increasing the volumes of the Community tariff quotas, opened for 1986, for certain grades of ferro-chromium falling within subheading ex 73.02 E I of the Common Customs Tariff
header:
COUNCIL  REGULATION (EEC) No 1800/86
of 9 June 1986
increasing the volumes of the Community tariff quotas, opened for 1986, for certain grades of ferro-chromium falling within subheading ex 73.02 E I of the Common Customs Tariff
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The volumes of the Community tariff quotas opened by Regulation (EEC) No 3454/85 for ferro-chromium containing not less than 4 % by weight of carbon, and not less than 6 % by weight of carbon, falling within subheading ex 73.02 E I of the Common Customs Tariff, shall be raised from 7 000 to 10 000 tonnes and from 210 000 to 295 000 tonnes respectively.

1. A first instalment of each of the additional volumes referred to in Article 1 and amounting to 2 500 and 75 000 tonnes respectively shall be allocated among certain Member States as follows:
(a) as regards ferro-chromium containing not less than 4 % by weight of carbon:
1.2 //  // (tonnes)   // Benelux   // 150   // Germany  // 750   // Italy   // 100   // United Kingdom   // 1 500
(b) as regards ferro-chromium containing not less than 6 % by weight of carbon:
1.2 //  // (tonnes)   // Benelux   // 6 600   // Germany  // 28 500   // Spain   // 5 000   // France   // 26 600  // Italy   // 1 700   // United Kingdom   // 6 600
2. The second instalments, being 500 and 10 000 tonnes respectively, shall constitute the reserves. The reserves provided for in Article 2 (2) of Regulation (EEC) No 3454/85 shall thus be raised from 500 to 1 000 tonnes and from 14 335 to 24 335 tonnes.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
